p: Previous studies reported that 54% of hemodialysis patients suffer from pain ( 98). Furthermore, 64% of pain is due to musculoskeletal issues and reveals in the legs ( 99). The experience of chronic pain has negative effects on patients; the resulting immobility causes high prevalence of depression, irritability, inability to cope with stress, increased fatigue, and reduced the quality of life ( 100). The topical application of rosemary was able to alleviate the frequency and severity of recurrence of musculoskeletal pain in these patients ( 101). So, rosemary induces its analgesic properties by affecting different antinociceptive pathways. But further detailed investigations are essential to determine the exact involved mechanisms through which rosemary exhibits its antinociceptive activities such as the number of inflammatory cells, apoptotic and microglial activation markers or the probable direct effect of rosemary on muscles.
